content.description: Located at the south end of the Middle Cliff Area, this bolted slab offers good climbing on clean, featured granite.Follow the line of bolts to the top of the wall.
content.location: Located at the south end of the Middle Cliff Area

content.description: Straightforward climbing on good rock and a bit run out after the second bolt. Follow the line of bolts to the top of the wall. Shares anchors with Well Protected, Fun, Easy Route.
Climb up the left facing corner to a good rest. At the second bolt, traverse out right past the arete and into the face. Continue up on easier ground to the top of the wall.
content.location: Find the obvious left facing corner, just left of Argentum.

content.description: 2nd bolted route on the Middle Cliff area. Very fun technical climbing on excellent rock. Height dependent crux near the end.
content.location: 2nd bolted route on the Middle Cliff

content.description: Middle Cliff area. 1st of 3 bolted routes on a steep slab. As the name suggests, the route is a series of mantles. The crux comes at the first mantle, and a second crux occurs near the top. Very fun.
content.location: Middle Cliff area - Steep slab to the left of hear rock. 1st bolted line on the slab with the roofs. Buy Herb's excellent guidebook for more beta

content.description: Climb up the slab past a few bolts, then traverse out right and continue up a short right facing corner. A nicely protected climb with cool moves up the right facing corner.
content.location: This is the first route on the wall, on the left side of the middle cliff area. easily recognizable by the huge roof/flake looming above the bolted slab.

content.description: An enjoyable, well-protected climb with fun sequences and cruxy moves near the top. Climb up the thin face to a roof, then up a flared crack and to the top of the wall.
content.location: This is the next route, to the right of Kernville Chopper

content.description: A very nice climb with good movement on solid rock. Climb past a small roof and continue up the face to a good rest below a large flake. Layback the flake and continue to the top of the wall.
